title: Lithuanian Rifle Corps
text:
The Lithuanian Rifle Corps () was a <a href="Rifleman">riflemen</a> unit of the <a href="Grand%20Duchy%20of%20Lithuania">Grand Duchy of Lithuania</a>.
History.
By 1789, <a href="sharpshooter">sharpshooter</a> <a href="platoon">platoon</a>s were formed in each Lithuanian <a href="infantry">infantry</a> <a href="battalion">battalion</a>. In 1791, the platoons were gathered into <a href="regiment">regiment</a>al <a href="Company%20%28military%20unit%29">companies</a>. Finally, they were consolidated into the Rifle Corps. In 1792, the rifle corps was formed in general Byszewski's reserve division.
Composition.
The Lithuanian Rifle Corps was composed of four battalions.
Uniforms.
Officers had a <a href="green">green</a> <a href="uniform">uniform</a> with <a href="poppy">poppy</a> <a href="red">red</a> <a href="Facing%20colour">facings</a>, one <a href="gold">gold</a>en <a href="epaulette">epaulette</a> and <a href="black">black</a> <a href="Hessian%20%28boot%29">Hessian boots</a>.
